intro: Hydrolea bartramii, commonly known as the Florida rainflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its stems are erect and often branched. Hydrolea bartramii plays an important ecological role by providing nectar for pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
